summary: The document is a memorandum from the Office of Central Cover (OCC) addressed to the John F. Kennedy Assassination Review Board, providing detailed responses to inquiries made during a briefing. It outlines the OCC's commercial cover program, highlighting its ties to the publications industry, the evolution in the number of participating companies from the 1960s to the present, and the confidentiality agreements signed by these companies. Included within the document are a secrecy agreement and an addendum pertaining to the Treasury, Postal Service and General Government Appropriations Act of 1991.
key_findings: The commercial cover program included a mix of genuine businesses from the publications industry and some with fabricated names to appear associated.
Participation in the commercial cover program grew significantly from about 500 companies in the 1960s to approximately 1,800 by the time the document was produced.
The secrecy agreement for the program saw minimal changes from 1955 to 1988, with an addendum introduced in 1991 in response to new legislative requirements.
keywords: Treasury, Postal Service and General Government Appropriations Act of 1991
John F. Kennedy Assassination Review Board
